citations.narrative:
Two outdoor enclosures housing two cockatoos and two hyacinth macaws contained excessive rust on the bottom wire
panels. In addition, multiple areas of rust were observed along the corners of the metal sheet barriers affixed to the sides
of several outdoor enclosures housing African greys and white-bellied caiques. Some areas are actively flaking and
contain jagged edges. These rusted areas prevent appropriate cleaning and sanitization and may compromise structural
integrity. These jagged surfaces also pose a risk of injury to the birds. A more effective plan is needed to repair and
maintain the enclosures in good repair. The facility shall ensure that any surfaces that the birds can encounter are free of
excessive rust or damage. Correct by July 29,2025.

The wooden shelter inside the outdoor enclosure housing 2 hyacinth macaws had a large area in the upper right corner
that was excessively chewed and splintered. The damaged wood presents a risk of injury as the birds move throughout
the shelter. The primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points or edges that
could injure the birds. Correct by July 15,2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.150(c)(2) 
   
Facilities, general. 
Two outdoor enclosures housing two cockatoos and two hyacinth macaws contained excessive rust on the bottom wire 
panels. In addition, multiple areas of rust were observed along the corners of the metal sheet barriers affixed to the sides 
of several outdoor enclosures housing African greys and white-bellied caiques. Some areas are actively flaking and 
contain jagged edges. These rusted areas prevent appropriate cleaning and sanitization and may compromise structural 
integrity. These jagged surfaces also pose a risk of injury to the birds. A more effective plan is needed to repair and 
maintain the enclosures in good repair. The facility shall ensure that any surfaces that the birds can encounter are free of 
excessive rust or damage. Correct by July 29,2025. 
3.153(a)(1)(i) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
The wooden shelter inside the outdoor enclosure housing 2 hyacinth macaws had a large area in the upper right corner 
that was excessively chewed and splintered. The damaged wood presents a risk of injury as the birds move throughout 
the shelter. The primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that they have no sharp points or edges that 
could injure the birds. Correct by July 15,2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
